events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection, triggering the initial claim.
After review, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to damage clearly resulting from a vehicular collision.
A claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the details and assist the customer with the next steps effectively.
The insurance provider officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and reassured the claimant that assistance is ongoing.
Requested the claimant submit additional documentation, including photos of the vehicle damage and a police accident report.
The claimant provided all requested documents on time, including detailed repair estimates and the official accident report.
An investigator was assigned to verify the claim details and inspect the vehicle damages reported in the documentation.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that damages were consistent with the described collision at the intersection.
The insurance company proposed a settlement amount based on vehicle repair costs and liability assessment.
The claimant expressed dissatisfaction with the proposed settlement amount, requesting a reassessment of the claim value.
Due to the customer’s concerns, the claim was escalated to a senior adjuster for further review and negotiation.
Following escalation, claim approval was granted with an increased settlement amount to better satisfy the customer.
The approved settlement payment was issued promptly and transferred to the insured’s account to facilitate repairs.
With payment completed and all issues resolved, the claim was formally closed in the insurer’s system.
